item.title: Remembering the Santa Fe Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Locals' Paradise
item.description:
A Different Kind of Vegas Dream: The Santa Fe’s Genesis

The Las Vegas Strip’s glamour often eclipses the stories of the city’s other developments. But tucked away in the northwest valley, a different kind of dream was taking shape. The Santa Fe Hotel and Casino opened its doors on February 14, 1991, at 4949 North Rancho Drive. This wasn’t intended to be another dazzling Strip spectacle; it was Paul Lowden’s Santa Fe Gaming Corporation’s ambitious project designed to serve the underserved Las Vegas locals. While the Strip was increasingly focused on attracting high-roller tourists, the Santa Fe aimed for families and residents seeking entertainment closer to home.
